intro: Spielmannia africana, commonly known as the African spider flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
